quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Title and Movie
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, title, nuts. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What movie was released in Japan under the title Sunny Classroom?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mr Holland’s Opus

questions.question: This Lithuanian American baseball player, son of immigrant parents, was born and raised in upstate New York. Who is he?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Johnny Podres

questions.question: This movie was released in Thailand as Zany Son-in-Law, Zippy Grandkids, Sour Father-in-Law.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Little Fockers

questions.question: Born in Pennsylvania, this performer has Lithuanian immigrant ancestors and goes by only one name.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pink

questions.question: Although he was born in Pittsburgh, he grew up in Brookline Pennsylvania. His parents were both Lithuanian immigrants. Who is this famous athlete?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Johnny Unitas

questions.question: The title of this movie was translated into German as Urban Neurotic.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Annie Hall

questions.question: This USA Senator was born in Illinois. His father was Irish/American and his mother was born in Lithuania.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dick Durbin

questions.question: Which of these English actors was actually born to a Lithuanian father.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Gielgud

questions.question: This movie was released in Mexico under the title An Unexpected End.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thelma and Louise

questions.question: What movie was released in Taiwan under the title Is The Spy Capable Or Not?

options.text: Austin Powers: International Man of Mystery

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Get Smart

questions.question: This Canadian is remembered as a show business personality. His ancestors were from Lithuania.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Candy

questions.question: What 2004 American movie was released in Italy under the title If You Leave Me, I Delete You?

options.text: Eternal Sunshine Of The Spotless Mind

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eternal Sunshine Of The Spotless Mind

questions.question: In Peru, the title of this film was translated as Slightly Pregnant, in China as One Night, Big Belly in Israel as The Date That Screwed Me and in Portugal Slightly Serious.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Knocked Up

questions.question: The title of this movie was translated into German as Full of the Nuts.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dodgeball

questions.question: This movie, starring Tom Cruise, was released in China under the weird title Just Send Him To University Unqualified.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Risky Business

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Planet and France
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, jokes, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: On January 23 2012, the European Union adopted an oil embargo against this country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Iran

questions.question: The last transit across the sun in the 21st century of this planet occurred on 5 and 6 June 2012.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Venus

questions.question: Two fish swim into a concrete wall. One turns to the other and says _________
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dam!

questions.question: They told me I had type-A blood, but _______________.

options.text: it was just one of those things

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: it was a Type-O

questions.question: I dropped out of the Communism class because of ________.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: lousy Marx

questions.question: I did a theatrical performance about puns. It was a ____________.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: play on words

questions.question: Jokes about German sausages are the _________.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: wurst

questions.question: Went on a class trip to the Coca-Cola factory. I hope theres ____________.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: no pop quiz

questions.question: A grenade thrown into a kitchen in France would result in _______________.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Linoleum Blownapart

questions.question: I crossed a cell phone with a skunk, and now ______________.

options.text: it has a rather bitter aroma

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the service stinks

questions.question: What movie was released in France under the title Sex Friends?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No Strings Attached

questions.question: On August 6, 2012, the Curiosity rover, which is part of a NASA mission, successfully landed on this planet.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mars

questions.question: In what month of 2012 was the Diamond Jubilee of Queen Elizabeth II celebrated?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: June

questions.question: When chemists die, apparently
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: they barium.

questions.question: The butcher backed into the meat grinder and got _____________________.

options.text: a little behind in his work
electrocuted along with some great cooked steaks

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a little behind in his work

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Country and Sentence
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, people, phrase. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Haunted French pancakes give me the _______.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: crepes

questions.question: In what sport was the largest number of records set at the 2012 Summer Olympics?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: swimming

questions.question: Dont join dangerous cults: Practice ________.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: safe sects!

questions.question: Venison for dinner again? (Provide the next phrase)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oh deer!

questions.question: Which of these was NOT reelected president of his country in 2012?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nicolas Sarkozy

questions.question: I used to be a banker, but then _________
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: I lost interest.

questions.question: In August 2012, this corporation became the most valuable public company of all time with a stock market value of around $623.52 billion.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Apple Inc.

questions.question: I tried to catch some fog, but  ________.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: I mist

questions.question: I didnt like my beard at first. (Provide the next sentence)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Then it grew on me.

questions.question: I got a job at a bakery because I _________.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: kneaded dough

questions.question: Im reading a book about anti-gravity. (Provide the next sentence),

options.text: Im reading it on the ceiling.
I just cant put it down.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: I just cant put it down.

questions.question: What natural disaster killed over 200 people in seven countries in October, 2012?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hurricane Sandy

questions.question: What nationality is Felix Baumgartner, the first person to break the sound barrier without any machine assistance?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Austrian

questions.question: What country launched operation Pillar of Defense on 14 November 2012?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Israel

questions.question: Broken pencils are pretty much _______ .
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: pointless

quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Sack and Cage
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, title, drama. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: It seems the Czech Republic had its own take on this movie since they called it Santa Is A Pervert. Whats the real name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bad Santa

questions.question: There are these two country farmers milking their cows. While the one farmer is milking, a fly zooms into the cows ear. The cow starts jumping around, shaking its head and mooing. He tries to steady the cow and suddenly it settles down. He looks down and sees the

options.text: in one ear and out the other
in one ear and out the udder
ya win a few ya lose a few

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: in one ear and out the udder

questions.question: Those who jump off a Paris bridge are ________.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: in Seine

questions.question: These two green beans were crossing the highway when one of them was hit by a large truck. His buddy scrapes him up and rushes him to the hospital. After hours of surgery the doctor comes in and says I have good news and bad news. The green bean starts to rejoice and the doctor says, The good news is that hes going to live. The bad news is ________________

options.text: hell be in my salad tonight.
he wont be stalking around anymore.
hell be a vegetable for the rest of his life.
hell never get back to his pod.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: hell be a vegetable for the rest of his life.

questions.question: This one from Spain should really be easy. They called it Knight of the Night, but its true name is what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Dark Knight

questions.question: Argentina used a little ingenuity to change this title to Vaseline. What is it in English?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Grease

questions.question: After Snow White used a couple rolls of film taking pictures of the seven dwarfs, she mailed the roll to be developed. Later she was heard to sing, ________________.

options.text: You Know My Name (Look Up The Number)
Some day my prints will come.
Some day my prince will come.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Some day my prints will come.

questions.question: A guy going into a restaurant is met by a waiter who tells him he must wear a tie to eat there. The guy goes out to his car and looks around for a necktie. He doesnt have one. He sees a set of jumper cables in his trunk. In desperation he ties these around his neck, manages to tie a smart looking knot and lets the ends dangle free. He goes back to the restaurant where the waiter stares at his tie for a moment and then says, Well, OK, I guess you can come in - _____________.

options.text: dont let the loose ends loose
just dont get attached to the silverware

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: just dont start anything

questions.question: Cleaning out the aviary at a run-down zoo, the keeper found two finches that had dropped dead from old age. He picked them up and placed them in a sack. After cleaning the cage he put the sack in his wheelbarrow and moved on to the next cage. When he reached the primate cage he found two chimps who had also died of natural causes. Waste not, want not he said as he put them in the sack with the finches. Later at feeding time, he flipped the animals from the sack into the lions cage. Oh no!! roared the lion __________.

options.text: Did you at least remove the feathers?

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Not finch and chimps again!

questions.question: A lady opened her refrigerator and saw a rabbit sitting on one of the shelves. What are you doing in there? she asked. The rabbit replied, This is a Westinghouse, isnt it? The lady furrowed her brow. Why, yes, she said, it is. Well, the rabbit said, ___________.

options.text: Im waiting for the carrots youre carrying.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Im westing.

questions.question: From Israel we get this translation: Super Horny. Whats the real name of this film?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Superbad

questions.question: An elephant was drinking out of a river one day, when he spotted a turtle asleep on a log. So, he ambled on over and kicked it clear across the river. What did you do that for? Asked a passing giraffe. Because I recognized it as the same turtle that took a nip out of my trunk 53 years ago. Wow, what a memory commented the giraffe. Yes, said the elephant. ______________.

options.text: And Im also a great kicker.
I have a memory like an elephant.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: I have turtle recall.

questions.question: During a performance for the high school drama class at the local theatre, a hole was cracked in the stage floor. Subsequent acts managed to avoid the damaged area until little Freddy, juggling bowling pins, accidentally stepped through the hole up to his knee. He apologized to the audience for his clumsiness. But a heckler in the back of the theatre shouted: Dont worry, Freddy! ______________.

options.text: Its just a stage youre going through!
Be thankful you didnt get bonked by the pins!

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Its just a stage youre going through!

questions.question: A boy had a crush on a girl at school. Every day his eyes would follow her wistfully, but he was so timid he couldnt work up the courage to speak to her.  Every time I open my mouth, he told his best friend, I get so embarrassed that I wish I could shrink down into a tiny pebble!  I know how you feel, his friend responded. But if you really want to talk to her, youll just have ___________.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: to be a little boulder!

questions.question: Patient: Nurse, I just swallowed my pillow! Nurse: How do you feel? Patient: _____________

options.text: Just take a look at my stomach.
A little down in the mouth.
How do think I feel, bloated.
I got a lump in my throat.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A little down in the mouth.

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Group and France
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, actor, avengers. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Can you figure out which of these is the correct name of a pop rock group formed in 1966?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tee set

questions.question: Denmark came up with a beauty of a movie title - The Boy Who Drowned in Chocolate Sauce. I dont think youll have any problems figuring out the real title.

options.text: Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory

questions.question: What actor is not correctly matched with the character he played in The Avengers?

options.text: Chris Evans - Steve Rogers / Captain America
Chris Hemsworth - Dr. Bruce Banner / Hulk
Robert Downey, Jr. -  Tony Stark / Iron Man

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chris Hemsworth - Dr. Bruce Banner / Hulk

questions.question: France also turned this short title into The Young People Who Traverse Dimensions While Wearing Sunglasses. If you saw the movie and its sequels, recognition will come quickly. If not, guess.

options.text: Young People Ask: How Can I Make Real Friends?

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Matrix

questions.question: Which of these letters is the correct spelling and whole name of the group that made famous the song Standing Ovation?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: GQ

questions.question: From France we get the delightful title Mom, I Missed The Plane which should point you to what movie below?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Home Alone

questions.question: Which of these choices is the correctly spelled name of a group that sings Gloria?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Shadows of Knight

questions.question: Can you find the correct spelling of this group/singer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lynyrd Skynyrd

questions.question: What is the correct name of the group who sings the song In the Summertime?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mungo Jerry

questions.question: The popular dance song Car Wash was made famous by this group. Try to find the correct spelling of their name.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rose Royce

questions.question: Which of these is the actual name of a group.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: We Five

questions.question: Pick out the name of a song made famous by a pop rock band from the Netherlands?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ma Belle Amie

questions.question: What is the correct name of a group active in the mid-1960s.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Cyrkle

questions.question: Another entry from France should be familiar to those of you that go a little overboard with fun making. Its called Very Bad Trip.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Hangover

questions.question: Try to find the name of a group whose name is spelled correctly.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Styx

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Movie and Jeanette Macdonald
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, raoul, stars. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What actress plays married aristocrat and socialite Anna Karenina, who questions her happiness in the 2012 movie of the same name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Keira Knightley

questions.question: This 1938 movie, based on a Victor Herbert operetta, stars Jeanette MacDonald and Nelson Eddy. It won an honorary Oscar for color cinematography. Songs included “Summer Serenade”, “On Parade” and “Little Grey Home in the West”. Frank Morgan and Ray Bolger (both from the Wizard of Oz) also starred. The title of song is the title of the movie.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sweethearts

questions.question: This 1938 film, starring Jeanette MacDonald and Nelson Eddy, was shot in sepia. It featured songs by Sigmund Romberg and Gus Kahn, including “Soldiers of Fortune” and “Shadows on the Moon. Other cast members included Walter Pigeon, Leo Carrillo (Pancho) and Buddy Ebsen.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Girl of the Golden West

questions.question: Who portrays former MI6 operative Raoul Silva in the twenty-third film of the James Bond film series, Skyfall?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Javier Bardem

questions.question: What 2012 movie is set in a dystopian post-apocalyptic future in the nation of Panem?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Hunger Games

questions.question: This 1936 film, starring Jeanette MacDonald and Nelson Eddy, was directed by W.S.Van Dyke II and was based on a Rudolph Friml-Herbert Stothart operetta. Indian Love Call was probably its most memorable duet. Other notable stars were James Stewart and David Niven.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rose Marie

questions.question: Who directed the 2012 crime thriller film Savages, which tells the story of two marijuana growers living in Laguna Beach, California?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oliver Stone

questions.question: Which 2012 movie stars Daniel Radcliffe as a penniless lawyer and widowed father?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Woman in Black

questions.question: In this movie, a reporter (Matthew McConaughey) and his younger brother (Zac Efron) investigate the events surrounding a murder.

options.text: The Odd Life of Timothy Green

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Paperboy

questions.question: This Jeanette MacDonald and Nelson Eddy 1940 film was based on a Noel Coward play and directed by W.S. Van Dyke II. The score included songs such as “Ziguener”, “If You Could Only Come With Me” and “Kiss Me”. The cast included George Sanders who won an Oscar for Supporting Role in All About Eve.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bitter Sweet

questions.question: What character does Woody Allen portray in his magical realist romantic comedy film To Rome with Love?

options.text: a clerk who wakes up to find himself a celebrity
an architect who takes a trip back to the street he lived on as a student
a funeral director who has a talent for singing in the shower

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a retired opera director

questions.question: Who portrays aging Atlanta Braves baseball scout Gus Lobel in the sports-drama film Trouble with the Curve?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Clint Eastwood

questions.question: The 1937 film, starring Jeanette MacDonald and Nelson Eddy, was directed by Robert Z. Leonard. Carry Me Back to Old Virginny and Student Drinking Song were a couple of the notable tunes. John Barrymore (The Great Profile) appeared in the movie as Nicolai Nazaroff.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Maytime

questions.question: This 1935 film was the first that starred Jeanette MacDonald and Nelson Eddy together. Some of Victor Herberts most famous songs are in the score of the movie. Two other notable actors were Frank Morgan (Wizard of Oz) and Elsa Lanchester (Bride of Frankenstein).
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Naughty Marietta

questions.question: Which movie stars Meryl Streep an Tommy Lee Jones as spouses who need help to ignite the spark back into their marriage?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hope Springs
